results.title: Young Einstein
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.brief_description: A classic Aussie comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock’n’roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio, John Howard, Peewee Wilson, Su Cruickshank.
description_for_label: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock `n’ roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock’n’roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio, John Howard, Peewee Wilson, Su Cruickshank.

results.title: Vietnam: The Ten Thousand Day War. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Don North, Ian Macleod, Paul Lang, Ron Kelly, Cinequity Funding and Information Television Productions
results.brief_description: Known as history’s first ‘living room war’, the Vietnam conflict is presented here with clarity, authority and insight. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner, Peter Arnett, and narrated by Richard Basehart, it’s seen through the eyes of key policymakers and fighting soldiers. The interviews, film clips, and commentary put this ‘police action’ into an illuminating perspective. “America in Vietnam” - gives an overall perspective of the shifting attitudes of the United States towards Vietnam, from the early liaison to the ultimate fall of Saigon. “Dien Bien Phu” - examines the French surrender at this crucial battle, and how it triggered 20 years of direct American involvement in Vietnam.

results.title: Vietnam: the long road home
results.creator_credit: Peter Corbett, Film Victoria, Portland Arts Advisory Board and Powerhouse
results.brief_description: This film, produced by a Vietnam war veteran, tells the story of ordinary Australians in the Vietnam war mainly from the point of view of conscripts, Channel 9 camera man Reg Boulter, a doctor, Michael Martin and two former political antagonists, Malcolm Fraser and Jim Cairns.

results.title: Vietnam, Australia's war
results.creator_credit: Joseph Matthews, Michael Phillips and Number One
results.brief_description: Examines Australia’s involvement in the Vietnam Conflict, 1962-72 using archival footage, stills, maps, home movies and newspaper headlines. Presents a chronological sequence of events during this period and queries Australia’s involvement. Addresses the long-term health and emotional effects of the conflict on veterans and their families.

results.title: How to cope with stress = coping with stress
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video Therapy with Alf Fowles”.
Stress is a normal, everyday part of life. People have different stress thresholds and individuals react to identical stressors to different degrees. British therapist, Alf Fowles, editor of the magazine “Natural Medicine”, explains how stress can affect our lives outlining the warning signs of possible mental breakdown and gives ten coping strategies. A simple self hypnosis technique to reduce stress is demonstrated at the conclusion of the program.

results.title: Young and just beginning: Pierre
results.brief_description: Focuses on Pierre Quinn, a young French-Canadian boy from Hauterive, Quebec, as he trains and performs along with other young dancers at the National Ballet School of Canada. When the school began, there were no male students but now of the 147 student one quarter are male. Theis change in attitude toward the male dancer was influenced to a great extent by Nuryev and Baryshnikov.

results.title: Video expeditions collection
results.brief_description: This series of travel documentaries is sure to delight. They engage even the most dedicated armchair traveller on a series of adventures guaranteed to create itchy feet and a desire to pack and head for the nearest travel agent.

results.title: The Thread makers
results.creator_credit: James Archibald, John Chittock and James Archibald and Associates
results.brief_description: Illustrates the nature of J. & B. Coats’ activities as makers and marketeers of thread of all types for every variety of use. Filmed in India, Austria, Spain, England and Scotland with a strong emphasis on the human interest. The development of synthetic thread, requiring new techniques and processes, is shown to be a likely prospect for the future

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.brief_description: This film takes a humorous look at all the safety errors committed in a short time in a typical office. It is effective in pointing out the hazards which exist in offices and the accidents which workers can cause - or control.
